Dhimal: totai, nirgai ‘throat, neck’ [< IA], ghoghoroŋ ‘throat, gullet’

Lhokpu: buŋr̥át ‘finger (except thumb and little finger)’, getsa ‘little finger’, tepaː ‘thumb’
kurlak ‘palm of hand’, doŋlak ‘sole of foot’
jap ‘backside, back’ [< Dz. jap], tseŋr̥ui ‘spinal column’

Dhimal: kondaŋ, mən ~ mon ‘feeling, heart, mind’ [< IA]

Lhokpu: tsanl̥íː, pojaka l̥íː, daːti [< Dz. dâchu]
Dhimal: kheʔti [(?) < kheʔli ‘to stick to something, to catch on something’]

Lhokpu: dzam ~ zam ‘reddish marrow of arm bones, leg bones, etc.’, tseŋnui ‘spinal cord (lit. “back-brain”)’
cutar ‘rumbling thunder’, metar ‘crashing thunder’, tarma ‘lightning and thunder’, m̥úk ŋil- ‘to thunder [m̥úk = “dragon”]’

Dhimal: jhar [< IA], jəŋgəl [< IA], cakiya ‘red jungle fowl (Gallus gallus)’
jinis ‘creature, thing’ [< IA], maini ‘female animal’, daŋkha ‘male animal’

Lhokpu: dzalma, riːpu ‘big constrictor’, l̥íkpulḁ́kpu ‘green tree snake’
toma, raçma ‘hornet’, riçma ‘wasp’, n̥uyma ‘black, dangerous wasp with red head’
l̥íːm, kaŋpu ‘red leech’, bedeːleŋ ‘tiger stripes leech’
-tsan, -piŋ ‘animal that has not yet given birth’
pasiŋ, nitsiŋ, tosiŋ, konsiŋ, patsiŋ, l̥ísiŋ

Dhimal: bhar ‘fruit, blossom’, seli ‘to bear fruit’, -se ‘fruit (used in compounds)’

Lhokpu: marku, amku ‘uncooked grain of any cereal’
ja ‘finger millet’, tsak ‘foxtail millet’, lóŋ, moi
so- ‘know how to, be able to’, yet- ‘know, be able to, understand’
Dhimal: nalli ‘to know somebody, recognise’, gili ‘know, find out, understand’, doli ‘to be able’

Lhokpu: tseŋ-, japtso(h)- ‘to stand with arms crossed on back’
yuç- ~ yuh- ‘to descend’, lõɁ- ~ loŋ- ‘to fall down’
Dhimal: khuɁli ‘get down, descend’, loŋli ‘to fall down’

Lhokpu: beɁ- ~ bey- ‘to come (only if not visible, only level or up, not down)’, ya- ‘to come (only if visible)’
Toto: le- ~ lei- ‘to come here, come down’, waŋ- ‘to come up, come from far’

Dhimal: puli ‘to go, leave, set out’, haneli ‘to go, leave’, khaɁli ‘to escape, flee, subside, ease up ’

Lhokpu: juk-, l̥óŋˀ- ~ lṍ̥ Ɂ- ‘to run away, flee, get lost’, liːm- ‘to get lost’
ton- ‘to go out, leave’ [< Dz. <ḥthon> thön]
Dhimal: oleli ‘to emerge, come out’, laŋli ‘to leave, go ahead’, hareli ‘to lose, fail’
jeŋli ‘to happen, be ashamed, be born’
muili ‘to be sick (of animals’, birami [< IA], desan ‘sick person’
teːli ‘to plaster, smear with a mixture of dung, water and mud’
aˈkheɁli ‘to be dirty, nasty, bad, vulgar’ [kheɁli = ‘to stick to, to catch on something’]

Lhokpu: dik- ‘be big’, boŋceŋ ‘big’, rin̥ka ‘long (humans and things)’

Dhimal: dhaŋli, boʔboʔli ‘to be warm and friendly’
miŋli ‘to be ripe, be cooked, be grey (of hairs)’
raːli ‘to tie up, bind’, jhiŋli ‘to tie up or together’, cuɁli ‘to tie in a knot’
deʔli ‘to lick, eat a small amount, taste’

Dhimal: dhuli ‘to wash (face)’ [(?) < IA], jhaːli ‘to wash, wet’

Lhokpu: doç ‘to throw from below, by swinging’
yem tir- ‘to weave on the loom’
